Formerly East Godavari District, now Kakinada District, Jaggampeta Mandal,
J.Kotturu Village Do.No. 2-125 Villagers (Late) Merapureddy Somaraju Gari
Wife 1) Merapureddy Ammaji Age 72 Years. (Aadhar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX) whose son is 2) Merapureddy Durgababu aged 42 years. (Aadhar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX) is a settlement document written and given jointly by the following persons.
You are the son of the 1st of us, and you are the only son of the 2nd of us. Therefore, in return for the love we have for you, we consider that we should give you some property as a reward, and we have entered the following schedule as our ancestral property, that is, the ancestral family of the 1st of us, husband and your father, Merapureddy Somaraju, with their brothers in the year 1985.
The property which was previously their share in the distribution of the estate and which they enjoyed without writing any documents, but which was transferred to us after their death, and which has been in our complete possession since that date, is hereby transferred to you free of charge without any consideration from you and the said estate is hereby transferred to you on this day. Therefore, from now on, you shall pay the taxes due to the government and the government, and shall enjoy the same freely and freely with all the powers of donation, donation and sale as you wish, for the benefit of your sons, grandsons and descendants. In this regard, we, our heirs, our assigns, and you, your heirs, and your assigns, will settle all such encumbrances at our own expense, and we will be able to continue to operate the property in accordance with the schedule below. You
Merapureddy, Rammaji

Declaration
I hereby declare that the property transferred by this deed does not include any trees like mango, coconut, betel, sweet potato etc., orchards, precious minerals, granite etc., stone mines, fish ponds, missionary etc. etc. We hereby declare that if any such facts are found to have been concealed in this deed, we will be liable to pay the tax and prosecution as per law.

Declaration
We are the sole owners of the property shown in this deed.

And that the said property is in our full and complete possession and enjoyment till date. And we have not committed any encroachment on this property till now. If in future it is found that any encroachment has been committed, we shall be liable under Section 22B of the Registration Act, 1908. And we hereby confirm that we shall be liable for all actions taken against us under Section 82 of the Registration Act.
The remaining stamp duty and fee user etc. charges shall be deposited in the form of CFMS challan.
This is a settlement document given in writing with our consent.
1. Merapureddy. Ammaneno
2. M Durlababu

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement deed No. 361 of 2026, dated 29/Jan/2026, executed by 1. Merapureddy Ammaj, 2. Merapureddy Durga Babu, in favour of Merapureddy Durga Babu [Where as Donee is the Son of 1st Donor and Donee is the Representing himself as 2nd Donor], towards the property admeasuring an extent of 104 Sq. Yds., Located Near by Door No. 2-125, comprised in survey number 164-2C, situated in J.Kothuru Village and Gramapanchayat, Jaggampeta Mandal, Erstwhile East Godavari now within the District of Kakinada, registered at sub-registrar office Jaggampeta is bounded as follows: North by: 31 Ft. House of Sainam Sankararao South by: 31 Ft. House of Sainam Lovaraju East by: 30 Ft. Road West by: 30 Ft. House of Bheedila Ganesh
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note It should be noted that the deed is executed by 2nd Donor representing himself as the Donee, thereby acting in a dual capacity, which constitutes a conflict of interest and is legally invalid. Therefore, it is advisable for the F.I. to verify the same and proceed as per its internal policy. Further, It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
